t: Psalm 89
A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I*pn will sing of the Lord’s*s great love forever; with*ld my mouth I will make your faithfulness known through*ld all generations.
I*ln will declare that your love stands firm forever, that*ld you have established your faithfulness in heaven itself.
You*ln said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I*ld have sworn to David my servant,
‘I*ln will establish your line forever and*ld make your throne firm through all generations.’ ”
The*pn heavens praise your wonders, Lord,*s your*ld faithfulness too, in the assembly of the holy ones.
For*ln who in the skies above can compare with the Lord?*s Who*ld is like the Lord*s among the heavenly beings?
In*ln the council of the holy ones God is greatly feared; he*ld is more awesome than all who surround him.
Who*ln is like you, Lord*s God Almighty? You,*ld Lord,*s are mighty, and your faithfulness surrounds you.
You*pn rule over the surging sea; when*ld its waves mount up, you still them.
You*ln crushed Rahab like one of the slain; with*ld your strong arm you scattered your enemies.
The*ln heavens are yours, and yours also the earth; you*ld founded the world and all that is in it.
You*ln created the north and the south; Tabor*ld and Hermon sing for joy at your name.
Your*ln arm is endowed with power; your*ld hand is strong, your right hand exalted.
Righteousness*pn and justice are the foundation of your throne; love*ld and faithfulness go before you.
Blessed*ln are those who have learned to acclaim you, who*ld walk in the light of your presence, Lord.*s
They*ln rejoice in your name all day long; they*ld celebrate your righteousness.
For*ln you are their glory and strength, and*ld by your favor you exalt our horn.
Indeed,*ln our shield belongs to the Lord,*s our*ld king to the Holy One of Israel.
Once*pn you spoke in a vision, to*ld your faithful people you said: “I*ln have bestowed strength on a warrior; I*ld have raised up a young man from among the people.
I*ln have found David my servant; with*ld my sacred oil I have anointed him.
My*ln hand will sustain him; surely*ld my arm will strengthen him.
The*ln enemy will not get the better of him; the*ld wicked will not oppress him.
I*ln will crush his foes before him and*ld strike down his adversaries.
My*ln faithful love will be with him, and*ld through my name his horn will be exalted.
I*ln will set his hand over the sea, his*ld right hand over the rivers.
He*ln will call out to me, ‘You are my Father, my*ld God, the Rock my Savior.’
And*ln I will appoint him to be my firstborn, the*ld most exalted of the kings of the earth.
I*ln will maintain my love to him forever, and*ld my covenant with him will never fail.
I*ln will establish his line forever, his*ld throne as long as the heavens endure.
“If*pn his sons forsake my law and*ld do not follow my statutes,
if*ln they violate my decrees and*ld fail to keep my commands,
I*ln will punish their sin with the rod, their*ld iniquity with flogging;
but*ln I will not take my love from him, nor*ld will I ever betray my faithfulness.
I*ln will not violate my covenant or*ld alter what my lips have uttered.
Once*ln for all, I have sworn by my holiness— and*ld I will not lie to David—
that*ln his line will continue forever and*ld his throne endure before me like the sun;
it*ln will be established forever like the moon, the*ld faithful witness in the sky.”
But*pn you have rejected, you have spurned, you*ld have been very angry with your anointed one.
You*ln have renounced the covenant with your servant and*ld have defiled his crown in the dust.
You*ln have broken through all his walls and*ld reduced his strongholds to ruins.
All*ln who pass by have plundered him; he*ld has become the scorn of his neighbors.
You*ln have exalted the right hand of his foes; you*ld have made all his enemies rejoice.
Indeed,*ln you have turned back the edge of his sword and*ld have not supported him in battle.
You*ln have put an end to his splendor and*ld cast his throne to the ground.
You*ln have cut short the days of his youth; you*ld have covered him with a mantle of shame.
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you hide yourself forever? How*ld long will your wrath burn like fire?
Remember*ln how fleeting is my life. For*ld what futility you have created all humanity!
Who*ln can live and not see death, or*ld who can escape the power of the grave?
Lord,*ln where is your former great love, which*ld in your faithfulness you swore to David?
Remember,*ln Lord, how your servant has been mocked, how*ld I bear in my heart the taunts of all the nations,
the*ln taunts with which your enemies, Lord,*s have mocked, with*ld which they have mocked every step of your anointed one.
Praise*pn be to the Lord*s forever! Amen*lc and Amen.
